title.narrative: Commonwealth Local Government GPS - Phase II

description.narrative: The Commonwealth Local Government Good Practice Scheme (CLGGPS) operates through twinning partnership arrangements with local councils in Australia. Its objective is to build capacity of selected urban local level governments in Papua New Guinea to promote their effective, responsive and accountable delivery of local authority services. The scheme utilises a partnership model that relies on voluntary services of Australians working in Australian Councils. So far partnerships have been established between the following Australian Councils and PNG Urban Local Level Governments: Orange City Council and Mt. Hagen Urban LLG; Cairns City Council and Lae Urban LLG; Townsville City Council and National Capital District Commission; Noosa City ( now Sunshine Coast) Council and Alotau Urban LLG; and Adelaide City Council and Madang Urban LLG. The total value of this initiative is $3.5 million over 4 years, starting 2009-10.
